The user is reporting that their markdown preview app works perfectly when built locally, but when downloaded via Homebrew, the markdown content is not visible. They want me to investigate the cause.

Let me first understand the project structure and then look into potential issues with Homebrew distribution vs local builds.

content.text: ローカルビルドでは動作するがHomebrew経由だと動作しない問題を調査します。まずプロジェクト構造とビルド設定を確認します。

input.prompt:
Investigate the mdpreview project to understand:
1. Project structure (key files and directories)
2. How the app is built (build system, scripts)
3. How it's distributed via Homebrew (look for Homebrew formula, Cask, release scripts)
4. How markdown rendering works (what resources/bundles are loaded)
5. Any resource loading code that might behave differently in a packaged/distributed app vs local build
6. Recent commits related to resource bundling or packaging issues (especially v1.2.4 "Fix resource bundle loading in packaged app" and v1.2.8)

Be very thorough - look at package.json, build configs, any Swift/Objective-C code, HTML/CSS/JS resources, and distribution files.

data.prompt:
Investigate the mdpreview project to understand:
1. Project structure (key files and directories)
2. How the app is built (build system, scripts)
3. How it's distributed via Homebrew (look for Homebrew formula, Cask, release scripts)
4. How markdown rendering works (what resources/bundles are loaded)
5. Any resource loading code that might behave differently in a packaged/distributed app vs local build
6. Recent commits related to resource bundling or packaging issues (especially v1.2.4 "Fix resource bundle loading in packaged app" and v1.2.8)

Be very thorough - look at package.json, build configs, any Swift/Objective-C code, HTML/CSS/JS resources, and distribution files.

content.content:
1→name: Release
     2→
     3→on:
     4→  push:
     5→    tags:
     6→      - "v*"
     7→  workflow_dispatch:
     8→    inputs:
     9→      version:
    10→        description: "Version (e.g., 1.2.1)"
    11→        required: false
    12→
    13→permissions:
    14→  contents: write
    15→
    16→jobs:
    17→  release:
    18→    name: Build & Release
    19→    runs-on: macos-latest
    20→
    21→    steps:
    22→      - name: Checkout
    23→        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    24→
    25→      - name: Show Swift version
    26→        run: swift --version
    27→
    28→      - name: Extract version
    29→        id: version
    30→        run: |
    31→          if [ "${{ github.event_name }}" = "workflow_dispatch" ] && [ -n "${{ inputs.version }}" ]; then
    32→            VERSION="${{ inputs.version }}"
    33→          else
    34→            VERSION="${GITHUB_REF_NAME#v}"
    35→          fi
    36→          echo "VERSION=$VERSION" >> "$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
    37→          echo "Building version: $VERSION"
    38→
    39→      - name: Update Info.plist version
    40→        run: |
    41→          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
    42→          sed -i '' "s/<string>1.0.0</<string>$VERSION</g" Supporting/Info.plist
    43→          sed -i '' "s/<string>1.0</<string>$VERSION</g" Supporting/Info.plist
    44→          sed -i '' "s/VERSION=.*/VERSION=\"$VERSION\"/" Supporting/mdpreview || true
    45→
    46→      - name: Update CLI version
    47→        run: |
    48→          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
    49→          sed -i '' "s/VERSION=\".*\"/VERSION=\"$VERSION\"/" Supporting/mdpreview
    50→
    51→      - name: Build release (arm64)
    52→        run: swift build -c release --arch arm64
    53→
    54→      - name: Build release (x86_64)
    55→        run: swift build -c release --arch x86_64
    56→
    57→      - name: Create app bundle
    58→        run: |
    59→          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
    60→          BUILD_DIR_ARM=$(swift build -c release --arch arm64 --show-bin-path)
    61→          BUILD_DIR_X86=$(swift build -c release --arch x86_64 --show-bin-path)
    62→
    63→          mkdir -p build/MDPreview.app/Contents/MacOS
    64→          mkdir -p build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources
    65→
    66→          # Create universal binary
    67→          lipo -create \
    68→            "$BUILD_DIR_ARM/MDPreview" \
    69→            "$BUILD_DIR_X86/MDPreview" \
    70→            -output build/MDPreview.app/Contents/MacOS/MDPreview
    71→
    72→          cp Supporting/Info.plist build/MDPreview.app/Contents/
    73→          cp Supporting/MDPreview.entitlements build/MDPreview.app/Contents/
    74→          cp Supporting/mdpreview build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources/mdpreview
    75→          chmod +x build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources/mdpreview
    76→
    77→          if [ -f "Assets/AppIcon.icns" ]; then
    78→            cp Assets/AppIcon.icns build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources/AppIcon.icns
    79→          fi
    80→
    81→          # Copy resource bundles
    82→          for bundle in "$BUILD_DIR_ARM"/*.bundle; do
    83→            [ -d "$bundle" ] && cp -R "$bundle" build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources/
    84→          done
    85→
    86→          # Verify architecture
    87→          echo "Binary architecture:"
    88→          lipo -info build/MDPreview.app/Contents/MacOS/MDPreview
    89→
    90→      - name: Install Apple certificate
    91→        if: env.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64 != ''
    92→        env:
    93→          DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64: ${{ secrets.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64 }}
    94→          DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_PASSWORD }}
    95→          KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD }}
    96→        run: |
    97→          # Create temporary keychain
    98→          KEYCHAIN_PATH=$RUNNER_TEMP/app-signing.keychain-db
    99→          security create-keychain -p "$KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD" $KEYCHAIN_PATH
   100→          security set-keychain-settings -lut 21600 $KEYCHAIN_PATH
   101→          security unlock-keychain -p "$KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD" $KEYCHAIN_PATH
   102→
   103→          # Import certificate
   104→          CERT_PATH=$RUNNER_TEMP/certificate.p12
   105→          echo -n "$DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64" | base64 --decode -o $CERT_PATH
   106→          security import $CERT_PATH -P "$DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_PASSWORD" -A -t cert -f pkcs12 -k $KEYCHAIN_PATH
   107→          security list-keychain -d user -s $KEYCHAIN_PATH
   108→
   109→      - name: Code sign (with Developer ID)
   110→        if: env.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64 != ''
   111→        env:
   112→          DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64: ${{ secrets.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64 }}
   113→          SIGNING_IDENTITY: ${{ secrets.SIGNING_IDENTITY }}
   114→        run: |
   115→          # Sign with entitlements
   116→          codesign --force --deep --sign "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" \
   117→            --entitlements Supporting/MDPreview.entitlements \
   118→            --options runtime \
   119→            --timestamp \
   120→            build/MDPreview.app
   121→
   122→          codesign --verify --verbose build/MDPreview.app
   123→
   124→      - name: Code sign (ad-hoc fallback)
   125→        if: env.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64 == ''
   126→        run: |
   127→          # Ad-hoc sign for local testing (not notarized)
   128→          codesign --force --deep --sign - \
   129→            --entitlements Supporting/MDPreview.entitlements \
   130→            build/MDPreview.app
   131→
   132→          codesign --verify --verbose build/MDPreview.app
   133→
   134→      - name: Verify dependencies
   135→        run: |
   136→          echo "=== Dynamic Libraries ==="
   137→          otool -L build/MDPreview.app/Contents/MacOS/MDPreview
   138→          echo ""
   139→          echo "=== Bundle Size ==="
   140→          du -sh build/MDPreview.app
   141→
   142→      - name: Create DMG
   143→        run: |
   144→          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
   145→          DMG_NAME="MDPreview-$VERSION.dmg"
   146→          mkdir -p dmg-staging
   147→          cp -R build/MDPreview.app dmg-staging/
   148→          ln -s /Applications dmg-staging/Applications
   149→          hdiutil create -volname "MDPreview" \
   150→            -srcfolder dmg-staging \
   151→            -ov -format UDZO \
   152→            "build/$DMG_NAME"
   153→          rm -rf dmg-staging
   154→          echo "DMG_NAME=$DMG_NAME" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
   155→
   156→      - name: Notarize DMG
   157→        if: env.APPLE_ID != ''
   158→        env:
   159→          APPLE_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_ID }}
   160→          APPLE_TEAM_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_TEAM_ID }}
   161→          APPLE_APP_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.APPLE_APP_PASSWORD }}
   162→        run: |
   163→          # Submit for notarization
   164→          xcrun notarytool submit "build/${{ env.DMG_NAME }}" \
   165→            --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
   166→            --team-id "$APPLE_TEAM_ID" \
   167→            --password "$APPLE_APP_PASSWORD" \
   168→            --wait
   169→
   170→          # Staple the notarization
   171→          xcrun stapler staple "build/${{ env.DMG_NAME }}"
   172→
   173→          echo "Notarization complete!"
   174→
   175→      - name: Create ZIP
   176→        run: |
   177→          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
   178→          ZIP_NAME="MDPreview-$VERSION.zip"
   179→          cd build
   180→          ditto -c -k --sequesterRsrc --keepParent MDPreview.app "$ZIP_NAME"
   181→          cd ..
   182→          echo "ZIP_NAME=$ZIP_NAME" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
   183→
   184→      - name: Calculate checksums
   185→        run: |
   186→          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
   187→          cd build
   188→          shasum -a 256 "${DMG_NAME}" "${ZIP_NAME}" > "MDPreview-$VERSION-checksums.txt"
   189→          cat "MDPreview-$VERSION-checksums.txt"
   190→          echo "CHECKSUM_NAME=MDPreview-$VERSION-checksums.txt" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
   191→
   192→      - name: Create GitHub Release
   193→        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v2
   194→        with:
   195→          draft: false
   196→          prerelease: ${{ contains(github.ref_name, '-') }}
   197→          generate_release_notes: true
   198→          files: |
   199→            build/${{ env.DMG_NAME }}
   200→            build/${{ env.ZIP_NAME }}
   201→            build/${{ env.CHECKSUM_NAME }}
   202→            build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources/mdpreview
   203→
   204→      - name: Cleanup keychain
   205→        if: always()
   206→        run: |
   207→          KEYCHAIN_PATH=$RUNNER_TEMP/app-signing.keychain-db
   208→          if [ -f "$KEYCHAIN_PATH" ]; then
   209→            security delete-keychain $KEYCHAIN_PATH || true
   210→          fi
   211→
   212→      - name: Commit version updates
   213→        if: github.event_name == 'push'
   214→        run: |
   215→          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
   216→          git config user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
   217→          git add Supporting/Info.plist Supporting/mdpreview || true
   218→          git diff --cached --quiet || git commit -m "chore: Update version to ${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
   219→          git push origin HEAD:main || true
   220→

Investigate the mdpreview project to understand:
1. Project structure (key files and directories)
2. How the app is built (build system, scripts)
3. How it's distributed via Homebrew (look for Homebrew formula, Cask, release scripts)
4. How markdown rendering works (what resources/bundles are loaded)
5. Any resource loading code that might behave differently in a packaged/distributed app vs local build
6. Recent commits related to resource bundling or packaging issues (especially v1.2.4 "Fix resource bundle loading in packaged app" and v1.2.8)

Be very thorough - look at package.json, build configs, any Swift/Objective-C code, HTML/CSS/JS resources, and distribution files.

content.content:
commit 8799294b35299dff98986d6e23acde758df1a4d3
Author: kazu-42 <91968271+kazu-42@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 27 01:06:21 2026 +0900

    fix: v1.2.4 - Fix resource bundle loading in packaged app
    
    - Avoid Bundle.module crash by checking app bundle locations first
    - Add safeModuleURL helper for fallback resource loading
    - Add test for base tag handling in template.html
    
    Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
    Entire-Checkpoint: adb4818f6e51

diff --git a/Sources/MDPreviewCore/MarkdownWebView.swift b/Sources/MDPreviewCore/MarkdownWebView.swift
index 36fa077..a2203e2 100644
--- a/Sources/MDPreviewCore/MarkdownWebView.swift
+++ b/Sources/MDPreviewCore/MarkdownWebView.swift
@@ -47,11 +47,21 @@ public struct MarkdownWebView: NSViewRepresentable {
     }
 
     private func loadTemplate(into webView: WKWebView, baseURL: URL?) {
-        guard let resourceURL = Bundle.module.url(
-            forResource: "template",
-            withExtension: "html",
-            subdirectory: "Resources"
-        ) else {
+        // Find template.html - check app bundle locations first to avoid triggering
+        // Bundle.module's resource_bundle_accessor which crashes in packaged apps
+        let possibleURLs: [URL?] = [
+            // App bundle: MDPreview_MDPreviewCore.bundle/Resources/template.html
+            Bundle.main.url(forResource: "MDPreview_MDPreviewCore", withExtension: "bundle")?
+                .appendingPathComponent("Resources/template.html"),
+            // Direct in Resources folder
+            Bundle.main.resourceURL?.appendingPathComponent("MDPreview_MDPreviewCore.bundle/Resources/template.html"),
+            // Fallback: try root Resources
+            Bundle.main.url(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html"),
+            // Last resort: Bundle.module (only works in SPM builds/tests)
+            safeModuleURL(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html", subdirectory: "Resources")
+        ]
+
+        guard let resourceURL = possibleURLs.compactMap({ $0 }).first(where: { FileManager.default.fileExists(atPath: $0.path) }) else {
             return
         }
 
@@ -66,6 +76,26 @@ public struct MarkdownWebView: NSViewRepresentable {
         webView.loadFileURL(resourceURL, allowingReadAccessTo: readAccessURL)
     }
 
+    /// Safely access Bundle.module without crashing in packaged apps
+    private func safeModuleURL(forResource name: String, withExtension ext: String?, subdirectory: String?) -> URL? {
+        // Only use Bundle.module if we're not in a packaged app
+        // Check if Bundle.main has an Info.plist (indicates packaged app)
+        guard Bundle.main.infoDictionary != nil,
+              Bundle.main.bundleIdentifier != nil else {
+            // Not a packaged app, safe to use Bundle.module
+            return Bundle.module.url(forResource: name, withExtension: ext, subdirectory: subdirectory)
+        }
+
+        // In packaged app, try to find the module bundle manually
+        let moduleName = "MDPreview_MDPreviewCore"
+        if let bundleURL = Bundle.main.url(forResource: moduleName, withExtension: "bundle") {
+            if let bundle = Bundle(url: bundleURL) {
+                return bundle.url(forResource: name, withExtension: ext, subdirectory: subdirectory)
+            }
+        }
+        return nil
+    }
+
     private func evaluateRender(webView: WKWebView, content: String, baseURL: URL? = nil) {
         let escaped = MarkdownWebView.escapeForJavaScript(content)
         let basePath = baseURL?.path ?? ""
diff --git a/Supporting/Info.plist b/Supporting/Info.plist
index 80fc254..65308b8 100644
--- a/Supporting/Info.plist
+++ b/Supporting/Info.plist
@@ -12,9 +12,9 @@
     <key>CFBundleDisplayName</key>
     <string>MDPreview</string>
     <key>CFBundleVersion</key>
-    <string>1.2.3</string>
+    <string>1.2.4</string>
     <key>CFBundleShortVersionString</key>
-    <string>1.2.3</string>
+    <string>1.2.4</string>
     <key>CFBundlePackageType</key>
     <string>APPL</string>
     <key>CFBundleInfoDictionaryVersion</key>
diff --git a/Supporting/mdpreview b/Supporting/mdpreview
index 24b34f9..f5ce522 100755
--- a/Supporting/mdpreview
+++ b/Supporting/mdpreview
@@ -1,7 +1,7 @@
 #!/bin/sh
 # MDPreview CLI - opens Markdown files and directories for preview
 
-VERSION="1.2.3"
+VERSION="1.2.4"
 APP="/Applications/MDPreview.app"
 
 show_help() {
diff --git a/Tests/MDPreviewCoreTests/MarkdownRenderingTests.swift b/Tests/MDPreviewCoreTests/MarkdownRenderingTests.swift
index 64ef6f1..ea332b7 100644
--- a/Tests/MDPreviewCoreTests/MarkdownRenderingTests.swift
+++ b/Tests/MDPreviewCoreTests/MarkdownRenderingTests.swift
@@ -23,6 +23,16 @@ final class MarkdownRenderingTests: XCTestCase {
             "template.html should contain the render(markdown, basePath) function")
     }
 
+    func testTemplateHTMLContainsBaseTagHandling() throws {
+        let url = try XCTUnwrap(
+            Bundle.module.url(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html", subdirectory: "Resources")
+        )
+        let content = try String(contentsOf: url, encoding: .utf8)
+        // Verify that the render function handles base URL for relative image paths
+        XCTAssertTrue(content.contains("base.href = 'file://' + basePath"),
+            "template.html should set base href for relative path resolution")
+    }
+
     func testTemplateHTMLContainsMarkedSetup() throws {
         let url = try XCTUnwrap(
             Bundle.module.url(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html", subdirectory: "Resources")

content.content:
commit 0ac4c171be0762fd5ffabd13a877b0e253b0a3ba
Author: kazu-42 <91968271+kazu-42@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 27 08:53:35 2026 +0900

    feat: v1.2.8 - Menu improvements and logging
    
    - Add logging system for debugging Homebrew installation issues
    - Fix duplicate View menu (use CommandGroup instead of CommandMenu)
    - Add Toggle Hidden Files (⇧⌘.) - same shortcut as Finder
    - Add Toggle Table of Contents menu (⌃⌘T)
    - Add Export Logs menu for debugging
    - Build as Universal Binary (arm64 + x86_64)

content.content:
1→APP_NAME = MDPreview
     2→BUNDLE_ID = dev.kazu42.mdpreview
     3→BUILD_DIR = $(shell swift build -c release --show-bin-path 2>/dev/null || echo .build/release)
     4→APP_BUNDLE = build/$(APP_NAME).app
     5→
     6→# Version from git tag or default
     7→VERSION := $(shell git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null | sed 's/^v//' || echo "1.2.1")
     8→
     9→.PHONY: all build bundle clean install cli run dev test dmg release universal
    10→
    11→all: build bundle
    12→
    13→build:
    14→	swift build -c release
    15→
    16→dev:
    17→	swift build
    18→	.build/debug/MDPreview $(FILE)
    19→
    20→test:
    21→	swift test
    22→
    23→bundle: build
    24→	rm -rf $(APP_BUNDLE)
    25→	mkdir -p $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/MacOS
    26→	mkdir -p $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Resources
    27→	cp $(BUILD_DIR)/MDPreview $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/MacOS/$(APP_NAME)
    28→	cp Supporting/Info.plist $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/
    29→	cp Supporting/mdpreview $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Resources/mdpreview
    30→	chmod +x $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Resources/mdpreview
    31→	@if [ -f "Assets/AppIcon.icns" ]; then \
    32→		cp Assets/AppIcon.icns $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Resources/AppIcon.icns; \
    33→	fi
    34→	@for bundle in $(BUILD_DIR)/*.bundle; do \
    35→		[ -d "$$bundle" ] && cp -R "$$bundle" $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Resources/; \
    36→	done
    37→	@# Update version in Info.plist
    38→	@sed -i '' "s/<string>1.0.0</<string>$(VERSION)</g" $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Info.plist
    39→	@sed -i '' "s/<string>1.0</<string>$(VERSION)</g" $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Info.plist
    40→	@codesign --force --sign - $(APP_BUNDLE)
    41→	@echo "Built: $(APP_BUNDLE) (v$(VERSION))"
    42→
    43→# Universal binary (arm64 + x86_64)
    44→universal:
    45→	@echo "Building universal binary..."
    46→	@rm -rf .build/arm64 .build/x86_64
    47→	swift build -c release --arch arm64
    48→	mv .build/apple/Products/Release .build/arm64 || mv .build/release .build/arm64-backup 2>/dev/null || true
    49→	swift build -c release --arch x86_64 || true
    50→	@# Create universal binary using lipo
    51→	@mkdir -p $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/MacOS
    52→	@mkdir -p $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Resources
    53→	@if [ -f ".build/arm64/MDPreview" ] && [ -f ".build/x86_64/MDPreview" ]; then \
    54→		lipo -create .build/arm64/MDPreview .build/x86_64/MDPreview -output $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/MacOS/$(APP_NAME); \
    55→	else \
    56→		echo "Warning: Building single architecture"; \
    57→		cp .build/release/MDPreview $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/MacOS/$(APP_NAME); \
    58→	fi
    59→	cp Supporting/Info.plist $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/
    60→	cp Supporting/mdpreview $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Resources/mdpreview
    61→	chmod +x $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Resources/mdpreview
    62→	@if [ -f "Assets/AppIcon.icns" ]; then \
    63→		cp Assets/AppIcon.icns $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Resources/AppIcon.icns; \
    64→	fi
    65→	@sed -i '' "s/<string>1.0.0</<string>$(VERSION)</g" $(APP_BUNDLE)/Contents/Info.plist
    66→	@codesign --force --sign - $(APP_BUNDLE)
    67→	@echo "Built universal: $(APP_BUNDLE)"
    68→
    69→clean:
    70→	swift package clean
    71→	rm -rf build/
    72→
    73→install: bundle
    74→	cp -R $(APP_BUNDLE) /Applications/
    75→	@echo "Installed to /Applications/$(APP_NAME).app"
    76→
    77→uninstall:
    78→	rm -rf /Applications/$(APP_NAME).app
    79→	rm -f /usr/local/bin/mdpreview
    80→	@echo "Uninstalled $(APP_NAME)"
    81→
    82→cli: install
    83→	@mkdir -p /usr/local/bin
    84→	@ln -sf /Applications/$(APP_NAME).app/Contents/Resources/mdpreview /usr/local/bin/mdpreview
    85→	@echo "Installed CLI: /usr/local/bin/mdpreview"
    86→
    87→run: bundle
    88→	open $(APP_BUNDLE)
    89→
    90→dmg: bundle
    91→	@rm -rf dmg-staging
    92→	@mkdir -p dmg-staging
    93→	@cp -R $(APP_BUNDLE) dmg-staging/
    94→	@ln -s /Applications dmg-staging/Applications
    95→	hdiutil create -volname "MDPreview" -srcfolder dmg-staging -ov -format UDZO build/MDPreview.dmg
    96→	@rm -rf dmg-staging
    97→	@echo "Built: build/MDPreview.dmg"
    98→
    99→# Full release with notarization (requires APPLE_ID, TEAM_ID, APP_PASSWORD env vars)
   100→release: dmg
   101→	@echo "Signing with Developer ID..."
   102→	codesign --sign "Developer ID Application: Takami Kazuihro (6RQMKB9NL7)" \
   103→		--deep --force --timestamp --options runtime \
   104→		--entitlements Supporting/MDPreview.entitlements \
   105→		$(APP_BUNDLE)
   106→	codesign --sign "Developer ID Application: Takami Kazuihro (6RQMKB9NL7)" \
   107→		--timestamp build/MDPreview.dmg
   108→	@echo "Notarizing..."
   109→	@xcrun notarytool submit build/MDPreview.dmg \
   110→		--apple-id "$${APPLE_ID}" \
   111→		--team-id "$${TEAM_ID}" \
   112→		--password "$${APP_PASSWORD}" \
   113→		--wait
   114→	xcrun stapler staple build/MDPreview.dmg
   115→	@echo "Release ready: build/MDPreview.dmg"
   116→

content.content:
1→#!/bin/sh
     2→# MDPreview CLI - opens Markdown files and directories for preview
     3→
     4→VERSION="1.2.8"
     5→APP="/Applications/MDPreview.app"
     6→
     7→show_help() {
     8→    cat << 'EOF'
     9→MDPreview - Lightweight Markdown preview app for macOS
    10→
    11→USAGE:
    12→    mdpreview [OPTIONS] [FILE|DIRECTORY...]
    13→
    14→OPTIONS:
    15→    -h, --help      Show this help message
    16→    -v, --version   Show version information
    17→
    18→EXAMPLES:
    19→    mdpreview                    Launch the app
    20→    mdpreview README.md          Preview a file
    21→    mdpreview file1.md file2.md  Open multiple files as tabs
    22→    mdpreview .                  Open current directory with file tree
    23→    mdpreview ~/projects/        Open a directory
    24→
    25→INSTALLATION:
    26→    brew install --cask kazu-42/tap/mdpreview
    27→
    28→For more information, visit: https://github.com/kazu-42/mdpreview
    29→EOF
    30→    exit 0
    31→}
    32→
    33→show_version() {
    34→    echo "mdpreview $VERSION"
    35→    exit 0
    36→}
    37→
    38→# Parse options
    39→while [ $# -gt 0 ]; do
    40→    case "$1" in
    41→        -h|--help)
    42→            show_help
    43→            ;;
    44→        -v|--version)
    45→            show_version
    46→            ;;
    47→        --)
    48→            shift
    49→            break
    50→            ;;
    51→        -*)
    52→            echo "mdpreview: unknown option '$1'" >&2
    53→            echo "Try 'mdpreview --help' for more information." >&2
    54→            exit 1
    55→            ;;
    56→        *)
    57→            break
    58→            ;;
    59→    esac
    60→done
    61→
    62→if [ $# -eq 0 ]; then
    63→    # No arguments - just open the app
    64→    open -a "$APP"
    65→    exit 0
    66→else
    67→    # Pass all arguments to the app
    68→    open -a "$APP" "$@"
    69→    exit 0
    70→fi
    71→

content.content:
1→import AppKit
     2→
     3→public enum CLIInstaller {
     4→    public static let destination = "/usr/local/bin/mdpreview"
     5→
     6→    public static var bundledCLIPath: String? {
     7→        Bundle.main.path(forResource: "mdpreview", ofType: nil)
     8→    }
     9→
    10→    public static var isInstalled: Bool {
    11→        FileManager.default.fileExists(atPath: destination)
    12→    }
    13→
    14→    public static func install() {
    15→        guard let source = bundledCLIPath else {
    16→            showAlert(
    17→                title: "Error",
    18→                message: "CLI tool not found in app bundle. Please reinstall MDPreview."
    19→            )
    20→            return
    21→        }
    22→
    23→        let script = """
    24→        do shell script "mkdir -p /usr/local/bin && ln -sf '\(source)' '\(destination)'" \
    25→        with administrator privileges
    26→        """
    27→
    28→        var error: NSDictionary?
    29→        NSAppleScript(source: script)?.executeAndReturnError(&error)
    30→
    31→        if error != nil {
    32→            return  // User cancelled the auth dialog
    33→        }
    34→
    35→        showAlert(
    36→            title: "Command Line Tool Installed",
    37→            message: "You can now use 'mdpreview' from the terminal.\n\nUsage:\n  mdpreview file.md\n  mdpreview ~/projects/"
    38→        )
    39→    }
    40→
    41→    private static func showAlert(title: String, message: String) {
    42→        let alert = NSAlert()
    43→        alert.messageText = title
    44→        alert.informativeText = message
    45→        alert.alertStyle = .informational
    46→        alert.addButton(withTitle: "OK")
    47→        alert.runModal()
    48→    }
    49→}
    50→

1→import XCTest
     2→@testable import MDPreviewCore
     3→
     4→final class MarkdownRenderingTests: XCTestCase {
     5→
     6→    // MARK: - Template HTML loads from bundle
     7→
     8→    func testTemplateHTMLExistsInBundle() {
     9→        let url = Bundle.module.url(
    10→            forResource: "template",
    11→            withExtension: "html",
    12→            subdirectory: "Resources"
    13→        )
    14→        XCTAssertNotNil(url, "template.html should be loadable from the resource bundle")
    15→    }
    16→
    17→    func testTemplateHTMLContainsRenderFunction() throws {
    18→        let url = try XCTUnwrap(
    19→            Bundle.module.url(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html", subdirectory: "Resources")
    20→        )
    21→        let content = try String(contentsOf: url, encoding: .utf8)
    22→        XCTAssertTrue(content.contains("function render(markdown, basePath)"),
    23→            "template.html should contain the render(markdown, basePath) function")
    24→    }
    25→
    26→    func testTemplateHTMLContainsBaseTagHandling() throws {
    27→        let url = try XCTUnwrap(
    28→            Bundle.module.url(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html", subdirectory: "Resources")
    29→        )
    30→        let content = try String(contentsOf: url, encoding: .utf8)
    31→        // Verify that the render function handles base URL for relative image paths
    32→        XCTAssertTrue(content.contains("base.href = 'file://' + basePath"),
    33→            "template.html should set base href for relative path resolution")
    34→    }
    35→
    36→    func testTemplateHTMLContainsMarkedSetup() throws {
    37→        let url = try XCTUnwrap(
    38→            Bundle.module.url(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html", subdirectory: "Resources")
    39→        )
    40→        let content = try String(contentsOf: url, encoding: .utf8)
    41→        XCTAssertTrue(content.contains("marked.use("),
    42→            "template.html should configure marked.js via marked.use()")
    43→        XCTAssertTrue(content.contains("gfm: true"),
    44→            "template.html should enable GitHub Flavored Markdown")
    45→    }
    46→
    47→    func testTemplateHTMLContainsContentDiv() throws {
    48→        let url = try XCTUnwrap(
    49→            Bundle.module.url(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html", subdirectory: "Resources")
    50→        )
    51→        let content = try String(contentsOf: url, encoding: .utf8)
    52→        XCTAssertTrue(content.contains("id=\"content\""),
    53→            "template.html should contain a div with id='content'")
    54→    }
    55→
    56→    func testTemplateHTMLContainsHighlightJS() throws {
    57→        let url = try XCTUnwrap(
    58→            Bundle.module.url(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html", subdirectory: "Resources")
    59→        )
    60→        let content = try String(contentsOf: url, encoding: .utf8)
    61→        XCTAssertTrue(content.contains("hljs.highlightElement"),
    62→            "template.html should use highlight.js for syntax highlighting")
    63→    }
    64→
    65→    // MARK: - Bundled JavaScript files
    66→
    67→    func testMarkedMinJSExistsInBundle() {
    68→        let url = Bundle.module.url(
    69→            forResource: "marked.min",
    70→            withExtension: "js",
    71→            subdirectory: "Resources"
    72→        )
    73→        XCTAssertNotNil(url, "marked.min.js should be bundled in Resources")
    74→    }
    75→
    76→    func testHighlightMinJSExistsInBundle() {
    77→        let url = Bundle.module.url(
    78→            forResource: "highlight.min",
    79→            withExtension: "js",
    80→            subdirectory: "Resources"
    81→        )
    82→        XCTAssertNotNil(url, "highlight.min.js should be bundled in Resources")
    83→    }
    84→
    85→    // MARK: - CSS files bundled
    86→
    87→    func testGitHubCSSExistsInBundle() {
    88→        let lightURL = Bundle.module.url(
    89→            forResource: "github.min",
    90→            withExtension: "css",
    91→            subdirectory: "Resources"
    92→        )
    93→        XCTAssertNotNil(lightURL, "github.min.css should be bundled in Resources")
    94→
    95→        let darkURL = Bundle.module.url(
    96→            forResource: "github-dark.min",
    97→            withExtension: "css",
    98→            subdirectory: "Resources"
    99→        )
   100→        XCTAssertNotNil(darkURL, "github-dark.min.css should be bundled in Resources")
   101→    }
   102→
   103→    // MARK: - Template HTML structure
   104→
   105→    func testTemplateHTMLHasProperStructure() throws {
   106→        let url = try XCTUnwrap(
   107→            Bundle.module.url(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html", subdirectory: "Resources")
   108→        )
   109→        let content = try String(contentsOf: url, encoding: .utf8)
   110→
   111→        XCTAssertTrue(content.contains("<!DOCTYPE html>"), "Should be a proper HTML5 document")
   112→        XCTAssertTrue(content.contains("<meta charset=\"utf-8\">"), "Should declare UTF-8 charset")
   113→        XCTAssertTrue(content.contains("marked.min.js"), "Should reference marked.min.js")
   114→        XCTAssertTrue(content.contains("highlight.min.js"), "Should reference highlight.min.js")
   115→    }
   116→
   117→    // MARK: - JavaScript escaping
   118→
   119→    func testEscapeForJavaScriptBackslash() {
   120→        let result = MarkdownWebView.escapeForJavaScript("a\\b")
   121→        XCTAssertEqual(result, "a\\\\b")
   122→    }
   123→
   124→    func testEscapeForJavaScriptBacktick() {
   125→        let result = MarkdownWebView.escapeForJavaScript("code: `hello`")
   126→        XCTAssertEqual(result, "code: \\`hello\\`")
   127→    }
   128→
   129→    func testEscapeForJavaScriptDollarSign() {
   130→        let result = MarkdownWebView.escapeForJavaScript("price: $10")
   131→        XCTAssertEqual(result, "price: \\$10")
   132→    }
   133→
   134→    func testEscapeForJavaScriptCRLF() {
   135→        let result = MarkdownWebView.escapeForJavaScript("line1\r\nline2")
   136→        XCTAssertEqual(result, "line1\\nline2")
   137→    }
   138→
   139→    func testEscapeForJavaScriptCR() {
   140→        let result = MarkdownWebView.escapeForJavaScript("line1\rline2")
   141→        XCTAssertEqual(result, "line1\\nline2")
   142→    }
   143→
   144→    func testEscapeForJavaScriptPlainText() {
   145→        let result = MarkdownWebView.escapeForJavaScript("Hello, World!")
   146→        XCTAssertEqual(result, "Hello, World!")
   147→    }
   148→
   149→    func testEscapeForJavaScriptCombined() {
   150→        let result = MarkdownWebView.escapeForJavaScript("Use `$HOME\\path`\r\n")
   151→        XCTAssertEqual(result, "Use \\`\\$HOME\\\\path\\`\\n")
   152→    }
   153→
   154→    func testEscapeForJavaScriptEmptyString() {
   155→        let result = MarkdownWebView.escapeForJavaScript("")
   156→        XCTAssertEqual(result, "")
   157→    }
   158→}
   159→

content.content:
1→# MDPreview 2→ 3→A lightweight, fast Markdown preview app for macOS. Built for developers who need to quickly preview `plan.md`, `README.md`, and other Markdown files from the terminal. 4→ 5→[日本語](docs/i18n/README.ja.md) | [한국어](docs/i18n/README.ko.md) | [Español](docs/i18n/README.es.md) | [Français](docs/i18n/README.fr.md) | [Deutsch](docs/i18n/README.de.md) | [Português](docs/i18n/README.pt-BR.md) | [简体中文](docs/i18n/README.zh-CN.md) 6→ 7→![macOS](https://img.shields.io/badge/macOS-13.0%2B-blue) 8→![Swift](https://img.shields.io/badge/Swift-5.9%2B-orange) 9→![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-green) 10→[![CI](https://github.com/kazu-42/mdpreview/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/kazu-42/mdpreview/actions/workflows/ci.yml) 11→ 12→

13→ 14→

15→ 16→## Features 17→ 18→- **Fast startup** - Native macOS app, opens instantly 19→- **Full GFM support** - Tables, task lists, strikethrough, autolinks 20→- **Syntax highlighting** - 40+ programming languages via [highlight.js](https://highlightjs.org/) 21→- **Live reload** - Automatically refreshes when the file changes on disk 22→- **Tabs** - Open multiple files as tabs, switch with Cmd+Shift+] / [ 23→- **File tree sidebar** - Open a directory to browse and preview Markdown files 24→- **Dark/Light mode** - Follows macOS system appearance 25→- **CLI-friendly** - `mdpreview file.md` launches instantly, returns to terminal 26→- **Zero dependencies** - No external Swift packages 27→- **Lightweight** - ~200KB binary + ~160KB bundled JS/CSS 28→ 29→## Installation 30→ 31→### Homebrew 32→ 33→```bash 34→brew install --cask kazu-42/tap/mdpreview 35→``` 36→ 37→### Download 38→ 39→Download the latest `.dmg` or `.zip` from the [Releases](https://github.com/kazu-42/mdpreview/releases) page. 40→ 41→After installing, open the app and go to **MDPreview > Install Command Line Tool...** to set up the `mdpreview` command. 42→ 43→### Build from Source 44→ 45→```bash 46→git clone https://github.com/kazu-42/mdpreview.git 47→cd mdpreview 48→ 49→# Build and create .app bundle 50→make all 51→ 52→# Install to /Applications 53→make install 54→ 55→# Install CLI (requires sudo) 56→sudo make cli 57→``` 58→ 59→## Usage 60→ 61→### From the Terminal 62→ 63→```bash 64→# Open a Markdown file 65→mdpreview README.md 66→ 67→# Open multiple files as tabs 68→mdpreview file1.md file2.md 69→ 70→# Open a directory with file tree sidebar 71→mdpreview . 72→mdpreview ~/projects/my-app/ 73→ 74→# Launch the app without arguments 75→mdpreview 76→``` 77→ 78→### From Finder 79→ 80→- **Drag and drop** a `.md` file onto the MDPreview window or Dock icon 81→- **Right-click** a `.md` file > Open With > MDPreview 82→- Use **Cmd+O** to open a file or directory from the menu 83→ 84→### Keyboard Shortcuts 85→ 86→| Shortcut | Action | 87→|----------|--------| 88→| `Cmd+O` | Open file / directory | 89→| `Cmd+W` | Close tab / window | 90→| `Cmd+Shift+]` | Next tab | 91→| `Cmd+Shift+[` | Previous tab | 92→| `Ctrl+Tab` | Next tab | 93→| `Cmd+1` - `Cmd+9` | Go to tab 1-9 | 94→| `Cmd+Q` | Quit | 95→ 96→## Screenshots 97→ 98→### Light Mode 99→

100→ 101→

102→ 103→### Dark Mode 104→

105→ 106→

107→ 108→## How It Works 109→ 110→MDPreview uses a minimal SwiftUI shell with a `WKWebView` for rendering. The rendering pipeline is: 111→ 112→``` 113→Markdown file on disk 114→ → Swift reads file content 115→ → Passes to WKWebView 116→ → marked.js converts to HTML (GFM) 117→ → highlight.js colorizes code blocks 118→ → CSS styles for dark/light mode 119→``` 120→ 121→File changes are detected using GCD's `DispatchSource` file system monitoring, with debouncing to handle rapid saves. 122→ 123→## Architecture 124→ 125→``` 126→Sources/ 127→├── MDPreviewCore/ # Core library 128→│ ├── MDPreviewApp.swift # SwiftUI App scene + commands 129→│ ├── AppDelegate.swift # Finder/CLI integration 130→│ ├── Workspace.swift # Tab management + state 131→│ ├── MainView.swift # Layout: sidebar + tabs + preview 132→│ ├── FileTree.swift # Directory tree model + view 133→│ ├── MarkdownWebView.swift # WKWebView wrapper 134→│ ├── FileWatcher.swift # DispatchSource file monitor 135→│ ├── CLIInstaller.swift # Command line tool installer 136→│ └── Resources/ 137→│ ├── template.html # HTML rendering shell 138→│ ├── marked.min.js # Markdown parser (GFM) 139→│ ├── highlight.min.js # Syntax highlighting 140→│ └── *.css # GitHub-style themes 141→└── MDPreview/ 142→ └── main.swift # Entry point 143→``` 144→ 145→## Requirements 146→ 147→- macOS 13.0 (Ventura) or later 148→- Apple Silicon or Intel Mac 149→ 150→### Build Requirements 151→ 152→- Xcode 15.0+ or Swift 5.9+ toolchain 153→- No additional dependencies required 154→ 155→## Contributing 156→ 157→Contributions are welcome! See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for guidelines. 158→ 159→Please note that this project follows a [Code of Conduct](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). 160→ 161→## Security 162→ 163→To report a security vulnerability, please see our [Security Policy](SECURITY.md). 164→ 165→## Acknowledgments 166→ 167→- [marked.js](https://github.com/markedjs/marked) - Markdown parser 168→- [highlight.js](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlight.js) - Syntax highlighting 169→- [QLMarkdown](https://github.com/sbarex/QLMarkdown) - UI/UX inspiration 170→ 171→## License 172→ 173→[MIT License](LICENSE) - see [LICENSE](LICENSE) for details. 174→

1→import XCTest
     2→import Combine
     3→@testable import MDPreviewCore
     4→
     5→final class IntegrationTests: XCTestCase {
     6→
     7→    private var tempDir: URL!
     8→
     9→    override func setUp() {
    10→        super.setUp()
    11→        tempDir = FileManager.default.temporaryDirectory
    12→            .appendingPathComponent("IntegrationTests-\(UUID().uuidString)")
    13→        try? FileManager.default.createDirectory(at: tempDir, withIntermediateDirectories: true)
    14→    }
    15→
    16→    override func tearDown() {
    17→        try? FileManager.default.removeItem(at: tempDir)
    18→        super.tearDown()
    19→    }
    20→
    21→    // MARK: - End-to-end: create, open, verify content
    22→
    23→    func testCreateOpenAndVerifyContent() {
    24→        let fileURL = tempDir.appendingPathComponent("e2e.md")
    25→        let markdownContent = """
    26→        # Integration Test
    27→
    28→        This is a **bold** statement.
    29→
    30→        - Item 1
    31→        - Item 2
    32→        - Item 3
    33→
    34→        ```swift
    35→        let x = 42
    36→        ```
    37→        """
    38→        try! markdownContent.write(to: fileURL, atomically: true, encoding: .utf8)
    39→
    40→        let ws = Workspace()
    41→        ws.openFile(fileURL)
    42→
    43→        XCTAssertNotNil(ws.selectedTab)
    44→        XCTAssertEqual(ws.markdownContent, markdownContent)
    45→        XCTAssertNil(ws.errorMessage)
    46→        XCTAssertTrue(ws.displayName.contains("e2e.md"))
    47→    }
    48→
    49→    // MARK: - End-to-end: modify file and verify update via file watcher
    50→
    51→    func testModifyFileAndVerifyUpdate() {
    52→        let fileURL = tempDir.appendingPathComponent("live-update.md")
    53→        try! "# Version 1".write(to: fileURL, atomically: true, encoding: .utf8)
    54→
    55→        let ws = Workspace()
    56→        ws.openFile(fileURL)
    57→        XCTAssertEqual(ws.markdownContent, "# Version 1")
    58→
    59→        let updated = expectation(description: "content updated via watcher")
    60→        var cancellable: AnyCancellable?
    61→        cancellable = ws.$markdownContent.dropFirst().sink { newValue in
    62→            if newValue == "# Version 2" {
    63→                updated.fulfill()
    64→                cancellable?.cancel()
    65→            }
    66→        }
    67→
    68→        DispatchQueue.main.asyncAfter(deadline: .now() + 0.2) {
    69→            try! "# Version 2".write(to: fileURL, atomically: false, encoding: .utf8)
    70→        }
    71→
    72→        waitForExpectations(timeout: 3.0)
    73→        XCTAssertEqual(ws.markdownContent, "# Version 2")
    74→    }
    75→
    76→    // MARK: - End-to-end: open via path string
    77→
    78→    func testOpenViaPathString() {
    79→        let fileURL = tempDir.appendingPathComponent("path-string.md")
    80→        try! "path test".write(to: fileURL, atomically: true, encoding: .utf8)
    81→
    82→        let ws = Workspace()
    83→        ws.openFromPath(fileURL.path)
    84→
    85→        XCTAssertEqual(ws.markdownContent, "path test")
    86→        XCTAssertTrue(ws.displayName.contains("path-string.md"))

    93→        let file2 = tempDir.appendingPathComponent("second.md")
    94→        try! "first file".write(to: file1, atomically: true, encoding: .utf8)

   105→        XCTAssertTrue(ws.displayName.contains("second.md"))

   108→        XCTAssertEqual(ws.tabs.count, 2)
   109→
   110→        // Switch back to first
   111→        ws.selectTab(ws.tabs[0].id)
   112→        XCTAssertEqual(ws.markdownContent, "first file")
   113→    }

   120→        # Unicode Test
   121→
   122→        Japanese: Swift is great.
   123→        Emoji: Rocket, Star, Heart
   124→        CJK: Zhongwen, Nihongo, Hangugeo
   125→        Math: E = mc^2

   133→    }

   138→        let fileURL = tempDir.appendingPathComponent("empty.md")
   139→        try! "".write(to: fileURL, atomically: true, encoding: .utf8)
   140→
   141→        let ws = Workspace()

   143→
   144→        XCTAssertEqual(ws.markdownContent, "")
   145→        XCTAssertNil(ws.errorMessage)
   146→    }
   147→
   148→    // MARK: - End-to-end: large file
   149→
   150→    func testLargeFile() {
   151→        let fileURL = tempDir.appendingPathComponent("large.md")
   152→        let lines = (1...1000).map { "Line \($0): Some markdown content here." }
   153→        let content = lines.joined(separator: "\n")

   156→        let ws = Workspace()

   159→        XCTAssertEqual(ws.markdownContent, content)

   168→
   169→        let ws = Workspace()

   171→        // Simulate what MDPreviewApp does when receiving a notification
   172→        NotificationCenter.default.post(name: .didRequestOpenFile, object: fileURL)

   175→        ws.openURL(fileURL)

1→import SwiftUI
     2→
     3→// MARK: - Model
     4→
     5→public struct FileTreeNode: Identifiable, Hashable {
     6→    public let id: String
     7→    public let url: URL
     8→    public let name: String
     9→    public let isDirectory: Bool
    10→    public var children: [FileTreeNode]?
    11→
    12→    public func hash(into hasher: inout Hasher) {
    13→        hasher.combine(id)
    14→    }
    15→
    16→    public static func == (lhs: FileTreeNode, rhs: FileTreeNode) -> Bool {
    17→        lhs.id == rhs.id
    18→    }
    19→
    20→    static let markdownExtensions: Set<String> = ["md", "markdown", "mdown", "mkd"]
    21→
    22→    // Note: Hidden files/directories (starting with .) are now shown
    23→    // Only skip common large/generated directories
    24→    private static let skippedDirectories: Set<String> = [
    25→        "node_modules", "build", ".build",
    26→        "DerivedData", "Pods", ".next", "dist", "target", "__pycache__",
    27→        ".venv", "venv", ".tox", ".cache",
    28→    ]
    29→
    30→    public static func buildTree(from url: URL, showHidden: Bool = true) -> [FileTreeNode] {
    31→        let fm = FileManager.default
    32→        let options: FileManager.DirectoryEnumerationOptions = showHidden ? [] : [.skipsHiddenFiles]
    33→        guard let contents = try? fm.contentsOfDirectory(
    34→            at: url,
    35→            includingPropertiesForKeys: [.isDirectoryKey],
    36→            options: options
    37→        ) else { return [] }
    38→
    39→        var nodes: [FileTreeNode] = []
    40→        for item in contents {
    41→            let name = item.lastPathComponent
    42→            let values = try? item.resourceValues(forKeys: [.isDirectoryKey])
    43→            let isDir = values?.isDirectory ?? false
    44→
    45→            if isDir {
    46→                guard !skippedDirectories.contains(name) else { continue }
    47→                let children = buildTree(from: item, showHidden: showHidden)
    48→                guard !children.isEmpty else { continue }
    49→                nodes.append(FileTreeNode(
    50→                    id: item.path, url: item, name: name,
    51→                    isDirectory: true, children: children
    52→                ))
    53→            } else {
    54→                nodes.append(FileTreeNode(
    55→                    id: item.path, url: item, name: name,
    56→                    isDirectory: false, children: nil
    57→                ))
    58→            }
    59→        }
    60→
    61→        return nodes.sorted { a, b in
    62→            if a.isDirectory != b.isDirectory { return a.isDirectory }
    63→            return a.name.localizedStandardCompare(b.name) == .orderedAscending
    64→        }
    65→    }
    66→}

    75→        self.nodes = nodes
    76→        self.workspace = workspace
    77→    }

content.text:
Perfect! Now I have a complete picture. Let me create the comprehensive investigation report:

## MDPreview Project Investigation Report

I've conducted a thorough investigation of the mdpreview project. Here's my detailed analysis:

### 1. PROJECT STRUCTURE

**Key Directories:**
- `/Users/kazu42/dev/mdpreview/Sources/` - Swift source code
  - `MDPreviewCore/` - Core library (App, UI, Rendering logic)
  - `MDPreviewCore/Resources/` - Web assets (HTML, JS, CSS)
  - `MDPreview/` - Entry point (main.swift)
- `/Users/kazu42/dev/mdpreview/Supporting/` - App metadata and CLI
  - `Info.plist` - macOS app configuration
  - `MDPreview.entitlements` - Code signing entitlements
  - `mdpreview` - Shell CLI wrapper script
- `/Users/kazu42/dev/mdpreview/Tests/` - Test suites
- `/Users/kazu42/dev/mdpreview/Assets/` - App icon (AppIcon.icns)
- `/Users/kazu42/dev/mdpreview/build/` - Built app bundle (MDPreview.app + DMG)
- `/Users/kazu42/dev/mdpreview/.github/workflows/` - CI/CD workflows

### 2. BUILD SYSTEM & CONFIGURATION

**Swift Package Configuration** (`Package.swift`):
- Swift 5.9+ requirement
- macOS 13.0+ deployment target
- Two targets:
  - `MDPreviewCore`: Library with resources (via `.copy("Resources")`)
  - `MDPreview`: Executable that depends on MDPreviewCore
  - `MDPreviewCoreTests`: Test suite

**Build Scripts:**
- **Makefile** (`/Users/kazu42/dev/mdpreview/Makefile`):
  - `make all` - Build and bundle app
  - `make universal` - Create universal binary (arm64 + x86_64)
  - `make bundle` - Create .app bundle, copy resources
  - `make install` - Install to /Applications
  - `make cli` - Install CLI symlink to /usr/local/bin
  - `make dmg` - Create DMG distribution
  - `make release` - Code sign with Developer ID and notarize

- **GitHub Actions Workflows** (`.github/workflows/release.yml`):
  - Triggered on git tags (v*)
  - Builds both arm64 and x86_64 architectures separately
  - Creates universal binary using `lipo`
  - Copies resource bundles: `$(BUILD_DIR)/*.bundle` → `Contents/Resources/`
  - Code signs with Developer ID (optional) or ad-hoc fallback
  - Creates DMG and ZIP distributions
  - Notarizes with Apple (if credentials provided)
  - Creates GitHub Release with artifacts

### 3. APP DISTRIBUTION & HOMEBREW

**Distribution Methods:**
- **Homebrew Cask**: `brew install --cask kazu-42/tap/mdpreview` (mentioned in README and CLI help)
- **GitHub Releases**: Publishes DMG, ZIP, and checksums
- **CLI Release Artifact**: Includes `mdpreview` shell script in release assets

**Note:** No Homebrew formula files found in the repo (would be in a separate tap repository: `kazu-42/tap`).

**App Bundle Structure** (from built artifacts):
```
build/MDPreview.app/Contents/
├── MacOS/MDPreview                    # Universal binary (arm64 + x86_64)
├── Resources/
│   ├── AppIcon.icns
│   ├── mdpreview                      # CLI wrapper script
│   └── MDPreview_MDPreviewCore.bundle/  # Resource bundle (auto-generated by SPM)
│       └── Resources/
│           ├── template.html
│           ├── marked.min.js
│           ├── highlight.min.js
│           ├── github.min.css
│           └── github-dark.min.css
└── Info.plist                          # Metadata + version
```

### 4. MARKDOWN RENDERING PIPELINE

**HTML Template** (`template.html`):
- Embedded single-page HTML with inline CSS and JavaScript
- Uses **marked.js** for GFM markdown parsing
- Uses **highlight.js** for syntax highlighting (40+ languages)
- GitHub-style CSS themes (light/dark mode)
- `render(markdown, basePath)` function accepts basePath for relative image resolution
- Dynamic heading ID generation for anchor links
- Scroll position preservation on content updates

**Resource Assets** (in `Sources/MDPreviewCore/Resources/`):
- `template.html` - Main rendering template
- `marked.min.js` - Markdown parser (~50KB)
- `highlight.min.js` - Syntax highlighter (~80KB)
- `github.min.css` - Light theme (~8KB)
- `github-dark.min.css` - Dark theme (~8KB)

**Total bundled size**: ~160KB of web assets + ~200KB binary

### 5. RESOURCE LOADING STRATEGIES

**Current Implementation** (`MarkdownWebView.swift`, lines 49-92):

The app implements a **multi-fallback resource loading strategy** to handle both development and packaged app scenarios:

```swift
let possibleURLs: [URL?] = [
    // 1. App bundle: MDPreview_MDPreviewCore.bundle/Resources/template.html
    Bundle.main.url(forResource: "MDPreview_MDPreviewCore", withExtension: "bundle")?
        .appendingPathComponent("Resources/template.html"),
    // 2. Direct in Resources folder
    Bundle.main.resourceURL?.appendingPathComponent("MDPreview_MDPreviewCore.bundle/Resources/template.html"),
    // 3. Fallback: try root Resources
    Bundle.main.url(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html"),
    // 4. Last resort: Bundle.module (only works in SPM builds/tests)
    safeModuleURL(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html", subdirectory: "Resources")
]
```

**Key Design Points:**
- **Avoids Bundle.module crash**: Checks Bundle.main locations first (module resource bundle may crash in packaged apps)
- **safeModuleURL() helper** (lines 94-112): Safely checks if it's a packaged app by inspecting `Bundle.main.infoDictionary` and `bundleIdentifier` before accessing `Bundle.module`
- **Comprehensive logging**: All path attempts are logged via `AppLogger` for debugging
- **File existence verification**: Only uses paths that actually exist on the filesystem

**Resource Access Pattern:**
```swift
webView.loadFileURL(resourceURL, allowingReadAccessTo: readAccessURL)
```
- Loads HTML from bundle, allows read access to markdown file's directory for relative path resolution

### 6. CRITICAL ISSUES FIXED

**v1.2.4 - Resource Bundle Loading** (commit 8799294):
- **Problem**: `Bundle.module` crashes in packaged macOS apps
- **Solution**: Check `Bundle.main` locations first, only fall back to `Bundle.module` in development/test scenarios
- **Impact**: Resolved crashes when running distributed app (DMG, Homebrew)

**v1.2.5 - Relative Image Path Resolution** (commit 7f851b3):
- **Problem**: Relative image paths in markdown weren't resolving correctly
- **Solution**: Added `rewriteRelativePaths()` function that converts relative paths to absolute `file://` URLs

**v1.2.7 - Apple Code Signing** (commit ce6aefc):
- Added entitlements file for proper code signing
- Support for both Developer ID and ad-hoc signing

**v1.2.8 - Logging & Menu Improvements** (commit 0ac4c17):
- Added comprehensive `AppLogger` system for Homebrew debugging
- Logs bundle paths, resource locations, and web view lifecycle
- Exports logs via menu for troubleshooting installation issues

### 7. PACKAGING DIFFERENCES: LOCAL vs DISTRIBUTED

**Local/Development Build** (via `swift build`):
- Resources loaded via `Bundle.module` (SPM mechanism)
- Runs in `.build/debug/` or `.build/release/`
- Module bundle not generated initially

**DMG/App Bundle Build** (via Makefile or GitHub Actions):
- Explicit `.app` bundle creation
- Resources bundled as `MDPreview_MDPreviewCore.bundle`
- Located in `Contents/Resources/`
- Binary is universal (arm64 + x86_64)

**Homebrew Installation**:
- Same .app bundle as DMG
- Installed to `/Applications/MDPreview.app`
- CLI symlinked to `/usr/local/bin/mdpreview` via AppleScript with admin prompt
- Bundled CLI script locates app at `/Applications/MDPreview.app`

### 8. KEY FILES BY RESPONSIBILITY

| File | Responsibility |
|------|-----------------|
| `MarkdownWebView.swift` | Resource loading, template injection, relative path rewriting, web view lifecycle |
| `Logger.swift` | Application-wide logging to `~/Library/Caches/MDPreview/Logs/mdpreview.log` |
| `Workspace.swift` | Tab/file management, state persistence, file tree building with hidden file toggle |
| `FileTree.swift` | Directory tree model, markdown file detection, skips large build directories |
| `FileWatcher.swift` | File system monitoring via DispatchSource, debounced change detection |
| `MainView.swift` | Layout (sidebar, tabs, TOC), drag-drop handling |
| `AppDelegate.swift` | Finder integration, CLI app opening, window lifecycle |
| `MDPreviewApp.swift` | Menu commands, CLI arg parsing, state restoration |
| `CLIInstaller.swift` | /usr/local/bin symlink installation via AppleScript+sudo |
| `template.html` | HTML5 shell with marked.js + highlight.js rendering |
| `Info.plist` | App metadata, bundle ID (dev.kazu42.mdpreview), document type handlers |
| `mdpreview` | CLI wrapper shell script that calls `open -a /Applications/MDPreview.app` |
| `release.yml` | CI/CD pipeline: build both archs, create universal binary, sign, notarize, release |
| `Makefile` | Local build automation with same steps as CI |

### 9. RECENT COMMIT HISTORY

```
0ac4c17 - v1.2.8 - Menu improvements, logging, hidden files toggle
ce6aefc - v1.2.7 - Apple signing support, hidden files
b983913 - v1.2.6 - TOC navigation, tab UI improvements
7f851b3 - v1.2.5 - Fix relative image path resolution
8799294 - v1.2.4 - Fix resource bundle loading in packaged app ← CRITICAL
```

The v1.2.4 fix is the cornerstone of reliable distribution - it's what enables the app to work correctly when installed via Homebrew or DMG.

### 10. VERSION MANAGEMENT

**Version stored in two places:**
1. `Supporting/Info.plist` - `CFBundleVersion` and `CFBundleShortVersionString`
2. `Supporting/mdpreview` - `VERSION="1.2.8"`
3. Release workflow updates both automatically from git tags

**Current version**: 1.2.8

This architecture ensures the CLI reports the same version as the GUI app.

- `/Users/kazu42/dev/mdpreview/.github/workflows/` - CI/CD workflows

### 2. BUILD SYSTEM & CONFIGURATION

**Swift Package Configuration** (`Package.swift`):
- Swift 5.9+ requirement
- macOS 13.0+ deployment target
- Two targets:
  - `MDPreviewCore`: Library with resources (via `.copy("Resources")`)
  - `MDPreview`: Executable that depends on MDPreviewCore
  - `MDPreviewCoreTests`: Test suite

**Build Scripts:**
- **Makefile** (`/Users/kazu42/dev/mdpreview/Makefile`):
  - `make all` - Build and bundle app
  - `make universal` - Create universal binary (arm64 + x86_64)
  - `make bundle` - Create .app bundle, copy resources
  - `make install` - Install to /Applications
  - `make cli` - Install CLI symlink to /usr/local/bin
  - `make dmg` - Create DMG distribution
  - `make release` - Code sign with Developer ID and notarize

- **GitHub Actions Workflows** (`.github/workflows/release.yml`):
  - Triggered on git tags (v*)
  - Builds both arm64 and x86_64 architectures separately
  - Creates universal binary using `lipo`
  - Copies resource bundles: `$(BUILD_DIR)/*.bundle` → `Contents/Resources/`
  - Code signs with Developer ID (optional) or ad-hoc fallback
  - Creates DMG and ZIP distributions
  - Notarizes with Apple (if credentials provided)
  - Creates GitHub Release with artifacts

### 3. APP DISTRIBUTION & HOMEBREW

**Distribution Methods:**
- **Homebrew Cask**: `brew install --cask kazu-42/tap/mdpreview` (mentioned in README and CLI help)
- **GitHub Releases**: Publishes DMG, ZIP, and checksums
- **CLI Release Artifact**: Includes `mdpreview` shell script in release assets

**Note:** No Homebrew formula files found in the repo (would be in a separate tap repository: `kazu-42/tap`).

**App Bundle Structure** (from built artifacts):
```
build/MDPreview.app/Contents/
├── MacOS/MDPreview                    # Universal binary (arm64 + x86_64)
├── Resources/
│   ├── AppIcon.icns
│   ├── mdpreview                      # CLI wrapper script
│   └── MDPreview_MDPreviewCore.bundle/  # Resource bundle (auto-generated by SPM)
│       └── Resources/
│           ├── template.html
│           ├── marked.min.js
│           ├── highlight.min.js
│           ├── github.min.css
│           └── github-dark.min.css
└── Info.plist                          # Metadata + version
```

### 4. MARKDOWN RENDERING PIPELINE

**HTML Template** (`template.html`):
- Embedded single-page HTML with inline CSS and JavaScript
- Uses **marked.js** for GFM markdown parsing
- Uses **highlight.js** for syntax highlighting (40+ languages)
- GitHub-style CSS themes (light/dark mode)
- `render(markdown, basePath)` function accepts basePath for relative image resolution
- Dynamic heading ID generation for anchor links
- Scroll position preservation on content updates

**Resource Assets** (in `Sources/MDPreviewCore/Resources/`):
- `template.html` - Main rendering template
- `marked.min.js` - Markdown parser (~50KB)
- `highlight.min.js` - Syntax highlighter (~80KB)
- `github.min.css` - Light theme (~8KB)
- `github-dark.min.css` - Dark theme (~8KB)

**Total bundled size**: ~160KB of web assets + ~200KB binary

### 5. RESOURCE LOADING STRATEGIES

**Current Implementation** (`MarkdownWebView.swift`, lines 49-92):

The app implements a **multi-fallback resource loading strategy** to handle both development and packaged app scenarios:

```swift
let possibleURLs: [URL?] = [
    // 1. App bundle: MDPreview_MDPreviewCore.bundle/Resources/template.html
    Bundle.main.url(forResource: "MDPreview_MDPreviewCore", withExtension: "bundle")?
        .appendingPathComponent("Resources/template.html"),
    // 2. Direct in Resources folder
    Bundle.main.resourceURL?.appendingPathComponent("MDPreview_MDPreviewCore.bundle/Resources/template.html"),
    // 3. Fallback: try root Resources
    Bundle.main.url(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html"),
    // 4. Last resort: Bundle.module (only works in SPM builds/tests)
    safeModuleURL(forResource: "template", withExtension: "html", subdirectory: "Resources")
]
```

**Key Design Points:**
- **Avoids Bundle.module crash**: Checks Bundle.main locations first (module resource bundle may crash in packaged apps)
- **safeModuleURL() helper** (lines 94-112): Safely checks if it's a packaged app by inspecting `Bundle.main.infoDictionary` and `bundleIdentifier` before accessing `Bundle.module`
- **Comprehensive logging**: All path attempts are logged via `AppLogger` for debugging
- **File existence verification**: Only uses paths that actually exist on the filesystem

**Resource Access Pattern:**
```swift
webView.loadFileURL(resourceURL, allowingReadAccessTo: readAccessURL)
```
- Loads HTML from bundle, allows read access to markdown file's directory for relative path resolution

### 6. CRITICAL ISSUES FIXED

**v1.2.4 - Resource Bundle Loading** (commit 8799294):
- **Problem**: `Bundle.module` crashes in packaged macOS apps
- **Solution**: Check `Bundle.main` locations first, only fall back to `Bundle.module` in development/test scenarios
- **Impact**: Resolved crashes when running distributed app (DMG, Homebrew)

**v1.2.5 - Relative Image Path Resolution** (commit 7f851b3):
- **Problem**: Relative image paths in markdown weren't resolving correctly
- **Solution**: Added `rewriteRelativePaths()` function that converts relative paths to absolute `file://` URLs

**v1.2.7 - Apple Code Signing** (commit ce6aefc):
- Added entitlements file for proper code signing
- Support for both Developer ID and ad-hoc signing

**v1.2.8 - Logging & Menu Improvements** (commit 0ac4c17):
- Added comprehensive `AppLogger` system for Homebrew debugging
- Logs bundle paths, resource locations, and web view lifecycle
- Exports logs via menu for troubleshooting installation issues

### 7. PACKAGING DIFFERENCES: LOCAL vs DISTRIBUTED

**Local/Development Build** (via `swift build`):
- Resources loaded via `Bundle.module` (SPM mechanism)
- Runs in `.build/debug/` or `.build/release/`
- Module bundle not generated initially

**DMG/App Bundle Build** (via Makefile or GitHub Actions):
- Explicit `.app` bundle creation
- Resources bundled as `MDPreview_MDPreviewCore.bundle`
- Located in `Contents/Resources/`
- Binary is universal (arm64 + x86_64)

**Homebrew Installation**:
- Same .app bundle as DMG
- Installed to `/Applications/MDPreview.app`
- CLI symlinked to `/usr/local/bin/mdpreview` via AppleScript with admin prompt
- Bundled CLI script locates app at `/Applications/MDPreview.app`

### 8. KEY FILES BY RESPONSIBILITY

| File | Responsibility |
|------|-----------------|
| `MarkdownWebView.swift` | Resource loading, template injection, relative path rewriting, web view lifecycle |
| `Logger.swift` | Application-wide logging to `~/Library/Caches/MDPreview/Logs/mdpreview.log` |
| `Workspace.swift` | Tab/file management, state persistence, file tree building with hidden file toggle |
| `FileTree.swift` | Directory tree model, markdown file detection, skips large build directories |
| `FileWatcher.swift` | File system monitoring via DispatchSource, debounced change detection |
| `MainView.swift` | Layout (sidebar, tabs, TOC), drag-drop handling |
| `AppDelegate.swift` | Finder integration, CLI app opening, window lifecycle |
| `MDPreviewApp.swift` | Menu commands, CLI arg parsing, state restoration |
| `CLIInstaller.swift` | /usr/local/bin symlink installation via AppleScript+sudo |
| `template.html` | HTML5 shell with marked.js + highlight.js rendering |
| `Info.plist` | App metadata, bundle ID (dev.kazu42.mdpreview), document type handlers |
| `mdpreview` | CLI wrapper shell script that calls `open -a /Applications/MDPreview.app` |
| `release.yml` | CI/CD pipeline: build both archs, create universal binary, sign, notarize, release |
| `Makefile` | Local build automation with same steps as CI |

### 9. RECENT COMMIT HISTORY

```
0ac4c17 - v1.2.8 - Menu improvements, logging, hidden files toggle
ce6aefc - v1.2.7 - Apple signing support, hidden files
b983913 - v1.2.6 - TOC navigation, tab UI improvements
7f851b3 - v1.2.5 - Fix relative image path resolution
8799294 - v1.2.4 - Fix resource bundle loading in packaged app ← CRITICAL
```

The v1.2.4 fix is the cornerstone of reliable distribution - it's what enables the app to work correctly when installed via Homebrew or DMG.

### 10. VERSION MANAGEMENT

**Version stored in two places:**
1. `Supporting/Info.plist` - `CFBundleVersion` and `CFBundleShortVersionString`
2. `Supporting/mdpreview` - `VERSION="1.2.8"`
3. Release workflow updates both automatically from git tags

**Current version**: 1.2.8

This architecture ensures the CLI reports the same version as the GUI app.

1→name: Release
     2→
     3→on:
     4→  push:
     5→    tags:
     6→      - "v*"
     7→  workflow_dispatch:
     8→    inputs:
     9→      version:
    10→        description: "Version (e.g., 1.2.1)"

    16→jobs:

    18→    name: Build & Release
    19→    runs-on: macos-latest
    20→
    21→    steps:
    22→      - name: Checkout

    25→      - name: Show Swift version

    34→            VERSION="${GITHUB_REF_NAME#v}"
    35→          fi
    36→          echo "VERSION=$VERSION" >> "$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
    37→          echo "Building version: $VERSION"
    38→
    39→      - name: Update Info.plist version
    40→        run: |
    41→          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
    42→          sed -i '' "s/<string>1.0.0</<string>$VERSION</g" Supporting/Info.plist
    43→          sed -i '' "s/<string>1.0</<string>$VERSION</g" Supporting/Info.plist

    50→
    51→      - name: Build release (arm64)

    53→
    54→      - name: Build release (x86_64)

    59→          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"

    61→          BUILD_DIR_X86=$(swift build -c release --arch x86_64 --show-bin-path)

    63→          mkdir -p build/MDPreview.app/Contents/MacOS

    72→          cp Supporting/Info.plist build/MDPreview.app/Contents/

    84→          done
    85→

    99→          security create-keychain -p "$KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD" $KEYCHAIN_PATH

   108→
   109→      - name: Code sign (with Developer ID)

   113→          SIGNING_IDENTITY: ${{ secrets.SIGNING_IDENTITY }}
   114→        run: |
   115→          # Sign with entitlements

   117→            --entitlements Supporting/MDPreview.entitlements \
   118→            --options runtime \
   119→            --timestamp \
   120→            build/MDPreview.app
   121→
   122→          codesign --verify --verbose build/MDPreview.app
   123→
   124→      - name: Code sign (ad-hoc fallback)
   125→        if: env.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64 == ''
   126→        run: |
   127→          # Ad-hoc sign for local testing (not notarized)
   128→          codesign --force --deep --sign - \
   129→            --entitlements Supporting/MDPreview.entitlements \
   130→            build/MDPreview.app
   131→
   132→          codesign --verify --verbose build/MDPreview.app
   133→
   134→      - name: Verify dependencies
   135→        run: |
   136→          echo "=== Dynamic Libraries ==="
   137→          otool -L build/MDPreview.app/Contents/MacOS/MDPreview
   138→          echo ""
   139→          echo "=== Bundle Size ==="
   140→          du -sh build/MDPreview.app
   141→
   142→      - name: Create DMG
   143→        run: |
   144→          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
   145→          DMG_NAME="MDPreview-$VERSION.dmg"
   146→          mkdir -p dmg-staging
   147→          cp -R build/MDPreview.app dmg-staging/
   148→          ln -s /Applications dmg-staging/Applications
   149→          hdiutil create -volname "MDPreview" \
   150→            -srcfolder dmg-staging \
   151→            -ov -format UDZO \
   152→            "build/$DMG_NAME"
   153→          rm -rf dmg-staging
   154→          echo "DMG_NAME=$DMG_NAME" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
   155→
   156→      - name: Notarize DMG
   157→        if: env.APPLE_ID != ''
   158→        env:
   159→          APPLE_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_ID }}
   160→          APPLE_TEAM_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_TEAM_ID }}
   161→          APPLE_APP_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.APPLE_APP_PASSWORD }}
   162→        run: |
   163→          # Submit for notarization
   164→          xcrun notarytool submit "build/${{ env.DMG_NAME }}" \
   165→            --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
   166→            --team-id "$APPLE_TEAM_ID" \
   167→            --password "$APPLE_APP_PASSWORD" \
   168→            --wait
   169→
   170→          # Staple the notarization
   171→          xcrun stapler staple "build/${{ env.DMG_NAME }}"
   172→
   173→          echo "Notarization complete!"
   174→
   175→      - name: Create ZIP
   176→        run: |
   177→          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
   178→          ZIP_NAME="MDPreview-$VERSION.zip"
   179→          cd build
   180→          ditto -c -k --sequesterRsrc --keepParent MDPreview.app "$ZIP_NAME"
   181→          cd ..
   182→          echo "ZIP_NAME=$ZIP_NAME" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
   183→
   184→      - name: Calculate checksums
   185→        run: |
   186→          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
   187→          cd build
   188→          shasum -a 256 "${DMG_NAME}" "${ZIP_NAME}" > "MDPreview-$VERSION-checksums.txt"
   189→          cat "MDPreview-$VERSION-checksums.txt"
   190→          echo "CHECKSUM_NAME=MDPreview-$VERSION-checksums.txt" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
   191→
   192→      - name: Create GitHub Release
   193→        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v2
   194→        with:
   195→          draft: false
   196→          prerelease: ${{ contains(github.ref_name, '-') }}
   197→          generate_release_notes: true
   198→          files: |
   199→            build/${{ env.DMG_NAME }}
   200→            build/${{ env.ZIP_NAME }}
   201→            build/${{ env.CHECKSUM_NAME }}
   202→            build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources/mdpreview
   203→
   204→      - name: Cleanup keychain
   205→        if: always()
   206→        run: |
   207→          KEYCHAIN_PATH=$RUNNER_TEMP/app-signing.keychain-db
   208→          if [ -f "$KEYCHAIN_PATH" ]; then
   209→            security delete-keychain $KEYCHAIN_PATH || true
   210→          fi
   211→
   212→      - name: Commit version updates
   213→        if: github.event_name == 'push'
   214→        run: |
   215→          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
   216→          git config user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
   217→          git add Supporting/Info.plist Supporting/mdpreview || true
   218→          git diff --cached --quiet || git commit -m "chore: Update version to ${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
   219→          git push origin HEAD:main || true
   220→

name: Release

on:
  push:
    tags:
      - "v*"
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      version:
        description: "Version (e.g., 1.2.1)"
        required: false

permissions:
  contents: write

jobs:
  release:
    name: Build & Release
    runs-on: macos-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Show Swift version
        run: swift --version

      - name: Extract version
        id: version
        run: |
          if [ "${{ github.event_name }}" = "workflow_dispatch" ] && [ -n "${{ inputs.version }}" ]; then
            VERSION="${{ inputs.version }}"
          else
            VERSION="${GITHUB_REF_NAME#v}"
          fi
          echo "VERSION=$VERSION" >> "$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
          echo "Building version: $VERSION"

      - name: Update Info.plist version
        run: |
          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
          sed -i '' "s/<string>1.0.0</<string>$VERSION</g" Supporting/Info.plist
          sed -i '' "s/<string>1.0</<string>$VERSION</g" Supporting/Info.plist
          sed -i '' "s/VERSION=.*/VERSION=\"$VERSION\"/" Supporting/mdpreview || true

      - name: Update CLI version
        run: |
          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
          sed -i '' "s/VERSION=\".*\"/VERSION=\"$VERSION\"/" Supporting/mdpreview

      - name: Build release (arm64)
        run: swift build -c release --arch arm64

      - name: Build release (x86_64)
        run: swift build -c release --arch x86_64

      - name: Create app bundle
        run: |
          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
          BUILD_DIR_ARM=$(swift build -c release --arch arm64 --show-bin-path)
          BUILD_DIR_X86=$(swift build -c release --arch x86_64 --show-bin-path)

          mkdir -p build/MDPreview.app/Contents/MacOS
          mkdir -p build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources

          # Create universal binary
          lipo -create \
            "$BUILD_DIR_ARM/MDPreview" \
            "$BUILD_DIR_X86/MDPreview" \
            -output build/MDPreview.app/Contents/MacOS/MDPreview

          cp Supporting/Info.plist build/MDPreview.app/Contents/
          cp Supporting/MDPreview.entitlements build/MDPreview.app/Contents/
          cp Supporting/mdpreview build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources/mdpreview
          chmod +x build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources/mdpreview

          if [ -f "Assets/AppIcon.icns" ]; then
            cp Assets/AppIcon.icns build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources/AppIcon.icns
          fi

          # Copy resource bundles
          for bundle in "$BUILD_DIR_ARM"/*.bundle; do
            [ -d "$bundle" ] && cp -R "$bundle" build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources/
          done

          # Verify architecture
          echo "Binary architecture:"
          lipo -info build/MDPreview.app/Contents/MacOS/MDPreview

      - name: Install Apple certificate
        if: env.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64 != ''
        env:
          DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64: ${{ secrets.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64 }}
          DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_PASSWORD }}
          KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD }}
        run: |
          # Create temporary keychain
          KEYCHAIN_PATH=$RUNNER_TEMP/app-signing.keychain-db
          security create-keychain -p "$KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD" $KEYCHAIN_PATH
          security set-keychain-settings -lut 21600 $KEYCHAIN_PATH
          security unlock-keychain -p "$KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD" $KEYCHAIN_PATH

          # Import certificate
          CERT_PATH=$RUNNER_TEMP/certificate.p12
          echo -n "$DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64" | base64 --decode -o $CERT_PATH
          security import $CERT_PATH -P "$DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_PASSWORD" -A -t cert -f pkcs12 -k $KEYCHAIN_PATH
          security list-keychain -d user -s $KEYCHAIN_PATH

      - name: Code sign (with Developer ID)
        if: env.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64 != ''
        env:
          DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64: ${{ secrets.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64 }}
          SIGNING_IDENTITY: ${{ secrets.SIGNING_IDENTITY }}
        run: |
          # Sign with entitlements
          codesign --force --deep --sign "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" \
            --entitlements Supporting/MDPreview.entitlements \
            --options runtime \
            --timestamp \
            build/MDPreview.app

          codesign --verify --verbose build/MDPreview.app

      - name: Code sign (ad-hoc fallback)
        if: env.DEVELOPER_ID_CERT_BASE64 == ''
        run: |
          # Ad-hoc sign for local testing (not notarized)
          codesign --force --deep --sign - \
            --entitlements Supporting/MDPreview.entitlements \
            build/MDPreview.app

          codesign --verify --verbose build/MDPreview.app

      - name: Verify dependencies
        run: |
          echo "=== Dynamic Libraries ==="
          otool -L build/MDPreview.app/Contents/MacOS/MDPreview
          echo ""
          echo "=== Bundle Size ==="
          du -sh build/MDPreview.app

      - name: Create DMG
        run: |
          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
          DMG_NAME="MDPreview-$VERSION.dmg"
          mkdir -p dmg-staging
          cp -R build/MDPreview.app dmg-staging/
          ln -s /Applications dmg-staging/Applications
          hdiutil create -volname "MDPreview" \
            -srcfolder dmg-staging \
            -ov -format UDZO \
            "build/$DMG_NAME"
          rm -rf dmg-staging
          echo "DMG_NAME=$DMG_NAME" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"

      - name: Notarize DMG
        if: env.APPLE_ID != ''
        env:
          APPLE_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_ID }}
          APPLE_TEAM_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_TEAM_ID }}
          APPLE_APP_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.APPLE_APP_PASSWORD }}
        run: |
          # Submit for notarization
          xcrun notarytool submit "build/${{ env.DMG_NAME }}" \
            --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
            --team-id "$APPLE_TEAM_ID" \
            --password "$APPLE_APP_PASSWORD" \
            --wait

          # Staple the notarization
          xcrun stapler staple "build/${{ env.DMG_NAME }}"

          echo "Notarization complete!"

      - name: Create ZIP
        run: |
          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
          ZIP_NAME="MDPreview-$VERSION.zip"
          cd build
          ditto -c -k --sequesterRsrc --keepParent MDPreview.app "$ZIP_NAME"
          cd ..
          echo "ZIP_NAME=$ZIP_NAME" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"

      - name: Calculate checksums
        run: |
          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
          cd build
          shasum -a 256 "${DMG_NAME}" "${ZIP_NAME}" > "MDPreview-$VERSION-checksums.txt"
          cat "MDPreview-$VERSION-checksums.txt"
          echo "CHECKSUM_NAME=MDPreview-$VERSION-checksums.txt" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"

      - name: Create GitHub Release
        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v2
        with:
          draft: false
          prerelease: ${{ contains(github.ref_name, '-') }}
          generate_release_notes: true
          files: |
            build/${{ env.DMG_NAME }}
            build/${{ env.ZIP_NAME }}
            build/${{ env.CHECKSUM_NAME }}
            build/MDPreview.app/Contents/Resources/mdpreview

      - name: Cleanup keychain
        if: always()
        run: |
          KEYCHAIN_PATH=$RUNNER_TEMP/app-signing.keychain-db
          if [ -f "$KEYCHAIN_PATH" ]; then
            security delete-keychain $KEYCHAIN_PATH || true
          fi

      - name: Commit version updates
        if: github.event_name == 'push'
        run: |
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
          git add Supporting/Info.plist Supporting/mdpreview || true
          git diff --cached --quiet || git commit -m "chore: Update version to ${{ steps.version.outputs.VERSION }}"
          git push origin HEAD:main || true
